channel.title: Wi-fi SoftAP
channel.description:
Okay, I need help with wifi. I have a wireless net card for my laptop. It's a pc card. I was wondering if I got a wireless net card and set it up as a soft ap, would I still be able to use the other card as the connection, like a normal router?
Thanks, Nicatron

item.title: Wi-fi SoftAP
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:171420”][quote author=nicatron link=topic=230733.msg1980685#msg1980685 date=1199604856]
soft Access Point. It uses your computer as a access point for Internet connection sharing. Like:

Internet <–> Router <–> Wireless connection <–> My PC <–> ICS <–> Other devices
[/quote]
It’s like ad-hoc or something isn’t it? You should be able to use it as a soft-ap and use it at the same time.

What is the other card by the way?[/quote]
the computer is supposed to make a infrastructure network using the other card and ICS or a net bridge…

Read full topic
